page.title: 08NEW ABBEY - HOUSING
page.content: The village has developed in two parts. The older properties (several belonging to Shambellie Estate or Messrs. Kingan, who own the Sawmill) lie along the winding village street. A local authority housing scheme of single storey dwellings,begun in 1932, was gradually extended until 1974. Some Council tenants have purchased their homes,and only one old cottage in the Square is without an inside toilet. Farmhouses are mostly 18th or 19th Century; most have been extended and modernised, as have the cottages for the farmworkers, some of which are now let as holiday houses. A 15th Century house once occupied by the last Abbot has been restored. Shambellie House is now a Costume Museum, the Laird living in a smaller residence. The old School has been converted to two private dwellings.
